Package com.cyberfront.crdt.sample.simulation

Class Executive

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cyberfront.crdt.sample.simulation.Executive

  • public class Executive
extends java.lang.Object
    The Executive class is used to manage the overall execution of the simulation of a distributed CRDT data store. Each of the distributed nodes are intended to have identical values for the objects managed within each CRDT at the conclusion of the test.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Executive.EventType
      An enumeration of the types of operations which the executive is managing

      • eventCount

        private long eventCount​()
        Compute and retrieve the total number of operations remaining in execution of the simulation. This number could grow as the number of operations to deliver are added to the message router
        Returns:
        The total number of pending operation remaining to complete the simulation

      • pickEvent

        private Executive.EventType pickEvent​()
        Randomly pick an event class based on the number of each of the remaining types of operations which the Executive is required to complete
        Returns:
        The event type of the next operation to perform

      • pickNode

        public Node pickNode​()
        Randomly pick a node from the collection of nodes
        Returns:
        The randomly chosen node

      • doCreate

        private java.util.Collection<Message<? extends AbstractDataType>> doCreate​(Node node,
                                                                           AbstractDataType object)
        Create a new object with the specified node as the owner. Generate and return the message set required to ensure all the other nodes can duplicate the create operation
        Parameters:
        node - The owning node for the new object
        object - Object for the Node to manage as an owning node
        Returns:
        The collection of messages generated in response to the creation of the new object in the specified node

      • doRead

        private java.util.Collection<Message<? extends AbstractDataType>> doRead​(Node node)
        Perform a read operation on a random object which exists in the given node. If the node in question does not have any objects to read, no further action is taken. Otherwise, the read operation is used to generate a collection of messages to duplicate the read operation at all of the other nodes
        Parameters:
        node - The node from which to read
        Returns:
        The collection of messages needed to duplicate the read operation elsewhere

      • doUpdate

        private java.util.Collection<Message<? extends AbstractDataType>> doUpdate​(Node node,
                                                                           java.lang.Double pChange)
        Perform an update operation on a random object which exists in the given node. If the node in question does not have any objects to update, no further action is taken. Otherwise, the update operation is used to generate a collection of messages to duplicate the update operation at all of the other nodes
        Parameters:
        node - The node from which to update
        pChange - Probability of changing a node field value
        Returns:
        The collection of messages needed to pass the update operation throughout the simulated distributed environment

      • doDelete

        private java.util.Collection<Message<? extends AbstractDataType>> doDelete​(Node node)
        Perform an delete operation on a random object which exists in the given node. If the node in question does not have any objects to delete, no further action is taken. Otherwise, the delete operation is used to generate a collection of messages to duplicate the delete operation at all of the other nodes
        Parameters:
        node - The node from which to update
        Returns:
        The collection of messages needed to pass the delete operation throughout the simulated distributed environment

      • doDeliver

        private java.util.Collection<Message<? extends AbstractDataType>> doDeliver​()
        Deliver the next message in the delivery queue to the node which is the intended recipient. Delivery of this next message may result in generation of a number of additional messages which are passed back to the calling routine.
        Returns:
        The collection of messages which results from delivery of the next message in the delivery queue

      • handleEvent

        private java.util.Collection<Message<? extends AbstractDataType>> handleEvent​(Executive.EventType type,
                                                                              Node node)
        Handle an event of the type provided. Handling the event may result in a collection of messages which need to be delivered
        Parameters:
        type - Type of event to handle next
        node - Node affected by handling of the event
        Returns:
        Collection of messages to deliver

      • execute

        public void execute​()
        Execute the simulation with the settings given.

      • generateNodes

        private void generateNodes​()
        Generate the nodes the simulation will use to perform its execution.

      • getRejectProbability

        public double getRejectProbability​()
        Retrieve the probability of rejecting an update or delete operation which occured at a non-owning node
        Returns:
        The reject probability

      • setRejectProbability

        public void setRejectProbability​(double rejectProbability)
        Set the probability of rejecting an update or delete operation which occurred at a non-owning node
        Parameters:
        rejectProbability - The new update or delete operation rejection probability

      • getUpdateProbability

        public double getUpdateProbability​()
        Gets the probability of updating an update of a specific field in an object being managed
        Returns:
        The update probability

      • setUpdateProbability

        public void setUpdateProbability​(double updateProbability)
        Sets the probability of updating an update of a specific field in an object being managed
        Parameters:
        updateProbability - The new probability for updating a field in a managed object

      • clear

        public void clear​()
        Initialize the simulation Executive for a new run.

      • registerCrdt

        public void registerCrdt​(SimCRDTManager<? extends AbstractDataType> crdt)
        Registers the node and username for the owner of the CRDT and the object it manages. If the entry already exists in the CRDT registry, it is not added (that is it does not override a previous entry)
        Parameters:
        crdt - The CRDT to register to look up owner name and user name associated with the CRDT

      • getOwnerNode

        public java.util.UUID getOwnerNode​(java.util.UUID id)
        Gets the owner node of the CRDT with the given ID
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the CRDT for which we're trying to get the owner node
        Returns:
        The ID value for the Node which owns the CRDT with the given ID value

      • getCrdtLookup

        private java.util.Map<java.util.UUID,java.util.UUID> getCrdtLookup​()
        Return the CRDT Node Lookup map to the calling routing
        Returns:
        The CRDT owner node lookup map

      • getSegment

        protected java.lang.String getSegment​()
        Return a segment needed to generate the serialized version of the Executive. The format is JSON-like
        Returns:
        The segment containing a string serialization of the Executiv in a JSON-like format.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • checkMessageConsistency

        public void checkMessageConsistency​()
        Check the consistency of the messages in each of the nodes. If there are any consistency issues, an IllegalStateException will be generated.

      • checkMessageCount

        public void checkMessageCount​()
        Check the count consistency of the messages in each of the nodes. If there are any consistency issues, an IllegalStateException will be generated.

      • checkOperationValidity

        public void checkOperationValidity​()
        Check the operational validity of each of the nodes. If there are any validity issues, an IllegalStateException will be generated.
